headline: AMD earnings, Netflix-Warner Bros. hearing: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Tuesday, February 3, including earnings results from companies like Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG), Pfizer (PFE), and Merck (MRK), and the Senate hearing on Netflix's (NFLX) proposed bid to acquire Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Merck Eyes Post Keytruda Growth With Eikon Stake And Guardant Pact
summary: Merck (NYSE:MRK) has invested $30 million for nearly a 10% stake in Eikon Therapeutics as Eikon moves toward an IPO. The company has also entered a multi year global oncology collaboration with Guardant Health focused on companion diagnostics and cancer therapies. These moves extend Merck’s reach in oncology and cancer diagnostics beyond its regular earnings activity. For investors watching NYSE:MRK, the new deals come with the stock around $113.37 and a 1 year return of 17.9%. Over 3 years...

headline: Merck Reports Earnings Tuesday Morning After Gaining 13% Over the Past Year
summary: Merck & Co. reports Q4 2025 earnings on Tuesday, Feb. 3, 2026, before market open. Wall Street expects earnings of $2.01 per share on revenue of $16.12 billion, representing 3.1% year-over-year growth. Shares have gained 13% over the past year, outperforming the healthcare sector’s broader returns. Here’s what investors should watch for. The Numbers That ... Merck Reports Earnings Tuesday Morning After Gaining 13% Over the Past Year

headline: Is It Time To Reassess Merck (MRK) After Strong Multi‑Year Share Price Gains?
summary: If you are wondering whether Merck’s current share price lines up with its underlying value, you are not alone, and this article walks through that question step by step. Merck shares last closed at US$110.27, with returns of 2.7% over the past week, 3.6% over the past month, 3.6% year to date and 14.7%, 16.1% and 80.6% over the past 1, 3 and 5 years respectively, which has many investors reassessing the risk and reward trade off. Recent headlines around Merck have continued to focus on its...
